meta_description: WCMA sparks new ways of thinking about art and the visual world through its innovative exhibitions, programs, publications and projects.
admission_text:
Come in, we're free!

June-August 

Open daily: 10 am to 5 pm

Thursdays 10 am to 8 pm.

September–May 

Open 10 am to 5 pm.  
Thursdays 10 am to 8 pm.  
Closed Wednesdays.

The museum will be closed from Dec. 21 through Jan. 1.

Visit the WCMA Shop at 76 Spring Street in Williamstown every day from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.

In addition to exhibition-related items—like the _Axis Mundo_ catalogue, Katie Paterson’s artist book _A place that exists only in moonlight_ , and music by Neil Leonard—our museum shop offers a delightful array of artful objects, including works by local makers, jewelry, toys, books, and accessories.

The shop will be closed Dec. 23 through Jan. 1.

You'll find us here: 

15 Lawrence Hall Drive  
Williamstown, MA 01267

Accessibility 

Accessible parking can be found on Lawrence Hall Drive. The museum’s galleries are wheelchair accessible. Please contact the museum at (413) 597-2429 if you have a special need or questions about access. 

Parking 

Parking is free on campus and in Williamstown.

Limited parking is available at the front of the museum on Lawrence Hall Drive. Visitors can also park on Spring Street and walk to the main entrance (no stairs) or the use the back entrance (stairs).

Parking map 

Groups 

Connect with [Hadley DesMeules](/web/20191214053856/https://wcma.williams.edu/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#fb939e9fcabb8c929797929a9688d59e9f8e) to set up a group visit. 

WCMA programs are supported in part by:
